rComments: The professor is excellent at teaching, he's one of those teacher that can save you time from trying to read and figure out what the hell the book is talking about. As a lecturer, he's very clear, and slowly spoken for the purpose of clarity. He basically reads it at a rate so that you can write down the note.

Great at simplifying and explaining material. Clear expectations for exams; Print out and annotate his study guides during lecture. Make sure you understand all the diagrams in the reading and you're golden. Some people find him boring but I thought he was hilarious!
Reading and taking countless amount of notes on the book is the golden key to doing well in his exams, which seem pretty fair. He also throws a generous curve.

Dalbey was an okay biology professor, he was interesting and tried to crack jokes, but most of them weren't that funny. Reading the book is a must if you want to get an A. He also has "study guides" so its a good thing to look them over before coming to class. The midterm was rough, but i found the final to be a lot better. Also he's retiring.

Nope avoid him if you can he teaches an undergraduate bio class like we're grad students. Expects way too much. I studied my butt off for two weeks for his midterm and only got a 65 percent and in high school I got a 5 on the AP test. AVOID HIM and SPARE YOURSELF!

Dalbey is not a great professor. His lectures are a complete waste of time (I attended all of them still). The material he goes over in his lectures do not specify at all what he wants from you on the test. He is hard to approach at his office hours and can be condescending.  Also he has no sympathy for his students. Horrible Professor, avoid!!!

Dalbey is the hardest professor that I have encountered. He expects a lot from you. But he is the best professor I have had. He is readily available for your questions, replies to your emails quickly, and has review sessions. His tests are extremely hard, but completely fair.  He gives assigned reading, do it! It will be on the exam.

He is a little opinionated, but a very helpful professor when it comes to writing a scientific paper. Study his notes and know his expectations well. His expectations are not clear sometimes and would be better to work on the homework as a group. His response to email is slow, but it is somewhat helpful. Overall, the lab is interesting!!
His tests are hard and most of his lectures don't cover the assigned readings

Not very good at lecturing, very monotonous and boring so I stopped going after 2 lectures. Read the book and extensive take notes on the book. Also make sure to memorize small details and do the study guides and book problems. His review sessions are okay and useful, though. Did all this and got a B+

Horrible w/ Lecturing! =( Just read the book, and memorize + UNDERSTAND every diagram/picture in the book within each chapter! That's the ONLY way you will pass. Also, his "practice exams" + "study guides" are VERY IMPORTANT. He recycles questions from his practice exams and from the self quizzes within the book. 55% in his class is passing.

He is a fun professor. He tries to make the class interesting by applying the learned information into everyday biological life. Although it was fascinating, not all of the information are written in the book. Therefore, know every information that he gives out (from lecture, lecture notes, homework, and so forth) if you want to pass.

didn't go to class at all, and got a score slightly below the class avg. after, read the book inside out, all the chapters and took heaps of notes. studied for the final and had endless nights, and pulled a B. don't recommend this teacher, if you do, reading the book is crucial cause he can't teach.

There are many ways to teach biology.  His way is really boring and puts you to sleep.  He sticks up an image on the projector and just talks about it for the whole lecture.  There are better teachers out there so just wait for someone else.

Every fault that seemed relatively harmless in 20A was very much in full effect during Biochem. Disorganized, monotonous, goes off on random tangents, worthless slides, and tests on specific details he only discussed very briefly(or not at all)in lecture. A very smart man, but a very poor teacher who turned an interesting topic into a nightmare.

He is the worst teacher I've ever had. Everything I learned, I learned on my own by reading the book.  I asked him for help and he told me if I was that desperate I could post fliers around school that said "I need a bio tutor I'll pay you 50 cents an hour".  Puts up a picture and talks about it for 30 minutes, so no actual notes in class.

If you read the book and attend lecture, simply put you will get an A. His lecture works off of the readings so doing the reading before class helps greatly. His tests are straightforward also, not too bad. Very clear and concise teaching style.

Had him for Bio 20A and 105, got an A in both. Straight forward tests, although difficult, his tests are fair. Put the time in and you will be fine...but if you don't...expect to be upset after the tests...which is why he curves a ton...because half the class does pretty horrible on a regular basis.

Great professor, he knows his stuff and he makes it interesting. His class is simple 40% midterm 60% final. He has so many resources online, if you actually read the assigned reading and go through the guides he puts online you should have no trouble getting an A or B

Probably one of the best teachers ive had so far at ucsc!!! He's by no means easy but he made me actually want to attend class. He also made the information entertaining!!! Take any class with Dalbey he will make it worth the work that you have to put in

He is a condescending prick. He is always talking down to people. Probably the worst personality on earth. He wears dirty clothes with paint all over them to class, one pant leg rolled up, then other rolled down. He is the hardest professor I have had. I heard he isn't as bad in other classes, but avoid him for biochem!
its a hard class, but hes an excellent teacher.  anyone whos made just doesnt do their work, or isnt smart enough to pass the class.  he makes it as easy as the class can be.
No Comments

He was a great professor. Very fair. I did poorly on midterms, but showed my stuff on the final, and gave me credit for it. It was excellent. He's a great teacher too, if you ask him questions and go to his office hours, he'll explain things.

a very nice and engaging guy. knows his stuff and is passionate about it. he loves to help, ask him any question. i very much enjoyed his lab, it has helped me score a great position at harvard medical.
No Comments
I've had dalbey on several occasions and hes a great lecturer.  hes there to help so ask him and you'll be great.

Take him for bio20L it's an easy "A" because he lets you correct and regrade things you did wrong on your labs. But! Be weary for real classes. He won't help you. He won't prepare you for the tests (he doesn't give out practice exams), is vague about what to study for, and his masogynistic undertones make you want to vomit.

This class was the hardest class i've taken at sc so far. He grades unfairly, his lectures barely reflect on the test and when it comes to tests he puts trick questions like what is this..the answer is nothing. He talks about random stuff that doesn't matter and the tests are ridiculously hard.

Had him for two upper divison labs...totally approachable and willing to help students. Very funny and relax in lab. Tells you exactly what he wants and demonstate experiments before hand so you're clean on what you're suppose to do. Grades consist of lab reports, attendance/participation, group presentation, quizzes or midterms/practical.

everyone who thinks Feldman's the worst bio prof is wrong: IT'S DALBEY. spent 30 minutes on something he blatantly said we wouldn't be tested on, super picky, brutal exams. thank god for MSI and the TAs. he has his funny moments, though. class was so boring it hurt. the book was a bonus - written for 2nd graders and much clearer than the prof.
I really liked Dalbey.  His lectures are funny and interesting.  I overstudied for the exams...I would reccomend studying the lecture notes more than the text.  Overall great class.

Smart and blessedly irreverent. Exam = what he emphasizes in lecture. No, doesn't don a cheerleader outfit and shout out exactly what will be on the exam, but sheesh, what do you expect?  Be very detailed in your answers - if you omit even the obvious, will assume you don't know and ding you for it.

Loved this class! Dalbey is totally laid-back and has a wry, dry sense of humor; a combo that could be easily overlooked and mistaken for a boring disposition. sort of picky grader but gave great eval, was helpful and enthus. in lab, and last lab was a nature hike. get him for 2-cred lab or microbio

Very cool and relax in lab.  Tells you what he expects and lab reports aren't difficult.  Midterms and practical are okay.  He's really there to help you in any way he can.  Enjoyed taking labs with him as an instructor---would totally recommend it!!!
Basically tells you everything he wants. Explains all experiments and what their purposes are. A little picky when it comes to grading, but not a hard grader. Very helpful during office hours.
Great teacher for labs and Micro, not for bio20a...he hates that class
lectures are a bit dry and he tends drag on certain subjects.  However, exams are pretty easy and he is very helpful during office hours.

This class is really great, because you have a lot of freedom to perform your own experiments, within the realm of the topic being studied. Due all the extra credit work you can, and your lab reports will be fine.

Nice guy but covers way too much.  Get ready for a lot of memorization.  Grading was only based on midterms (40%) and final(60%). Didn't give review sheet and doesn't like to give old tests for review either.

I'll tell you this class is impossible... I studied 5 straight days with lack of sleep. drank 4 rockstars and smoke a pack of cigarette just for the final. the results? C in the class. gosh... shoot me please..
Very hard tests, had to study my ass off, but got an A...should go to all classes and keep up with the reading. Mike really knows his stuff, but he doesn't realize thta this is an undergrad class.

Did this guy care about our progress or what!  We constantly got emails answering common questions we had about the material.  Very helpful, had office hours all the time, and he invited the students to bike rides on weekends.  One of the best professors I've had, hands down my favorite.

his lectures are misleading.  he does a song and dance and dumbs down his lectures, but then asks for crazy details. he does use a crazy curve though, so failing the tests doesn't mean you will fail. do the reading maybe twice. 75% = A go figure.

There is no way to prepare for the types of questions he asks on his exams. Some are fair game and others are waaaaay out there. It can be really frustrating. I got an A in the class somehow even though I got a C on the first out of only two tests that determine your grade. I just think he is nutty. Oye vey.

This class is definitely demanding, but Dalbey is a great professor. He made an effort to be available to his students, even offering up his weekend time to hold review sessions before the tests. Tests are difficult, but if you do what you're supposed to do (read the book, go to lecture and sections, see him in office hours), then you can do well.

im speaking for the 3/4 of the students who didn't pass his first midterm. he is ****ing hard ass teacher. study everyday without socializing will not give a possible passing grade. good luck if you wanna take him

Dalbey wasn't that hard. I stopped attending lecture after the first midterm, and I got an A.  I did all the hw and reading, and understood them as well.  His tests are tricky, but understandable.  I think if base your studying off the hw, you'll be fine

Dalbey seems like a chill guy, he makes all sorts of hippie references in class and does these little dances to represent certain processes but his lectures are really misleading- the material seems to be really easy but he actually expects A LOT more for the test. Do the reading, memorize details, it'll save your ass. 45% midterm 55% final
Good guy, good prof.

HORRIBLE, ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE! He takes pleaure in failing students despite any considerable amount of work students put in the course. Do not take this class with him. Dalbey is the absolute worst professor I have ever had at UCSC. He cannot teach the material. He doesn't care about his students. He also has the personality of a dead fish...

dalbey's overrated. definitely doesn't make genetics a FUN class. exams are difficult and there are only two of them so don't screw up the first one. possible to get a good grade in the class if you read and do problems, though there are sooo many of them i got pretty disinterested pretty fast.

Mike is a great proff. Want an A? Read the book, attend lectures, do all problems, go to sections. The test questions are from the homework and lecture. Your TA will save your butt if you work with them, doing problems and participating in section. Get to know your weaknesses and then work on them! Thanks Mike and Mike!

Genetics is a hard class to begin with. Dalbey did a good job lecturing (lectures were clear). His tests are pretty tough, and even though he says he doesn't trick people, he finds ways to do it. Grading... you have no idea what you have until the grades come out at the end.. managed a B with lots of effort. Not a bad choice for genetics.

his tests were really hard; my class had 60% multiple choice & 40% fill-in; study supplumental problems, go to office hours, make good friends with your ta, get study group. im not sure that i passed this class even tho i was above avg on midterm (45% midterm, 55% final)

He's super HARD! Do not take him.I recommend Saltikov for Biol-119L. Otherwise you'll be stuck with so much lab work indoors that you'll never see the sun again. He expects way too much for a lab course.

Difficult class. An okay professor. At first I thought he was great until he yelled at me when I came to one of his office hours. He's very condescending. He doesn't tell anyone where they stand in the class either. One midterm is 45% of the grade and the final is 55% and that is all you'll ever know.

GREAT teacher. He's really caring and attentive. Really wants his students to succeed. The class is far from easy, but if you do the homework and go to MSI and office hours, you should be fine. Honestly one of the best bio lecturers around.

He makes the subject more interesting.  He tells great stories that relate to the subject to make the confusing stuff more understandable. This isn't an easy class but if you study his supplemental problems and read the book, you'll do good. I am taking physics and another upper div bio class and I still managed to get a good score on the midterm.

One of the best teachers I've had. Funny, interesting, great lecturer. Speaks clearly, concisely, and precisely. Exams were fair. Do all your homework and ask questions. He's really good at answering them.
Lectures were okay, but a bit confusing. Exams were difficult---make sure you know your stuff!
could be more for the student.  Very CONDESENDING

Did not like his lecture style.He moves way too fast. Ridiculous grader. Tests extremely hard and covers too much. Will never specify what he wants emphasized and when he does, it ends up not being worth much on the test anyway.
No Comments

He's a nice guy, not a bad lecturer, although sometimes a bit dry. His grading policy was 40% midterm, 60% final, which was really freaky, cuz his tests are not easy. Just study hard, and you should be fine. You really use this information in upper divs.
No Comments
No Comments
Great lab teacher but a little dry and regimented in lecture. Tests and work nontrivial but not difficult, and based on lectures. Really nice guy.

Probably one of the best teachers ive had so far at ucsc!!! He's by no means easy but he made me actually want to attend class. He also made the information entertaining!!! Take any class with Dalby he will make it worth the work that you have to put in
First of all why the heck is his name spelled "dalby???" Lectures are not very helpful. Not the greatest lecturer..

I took 3 classes with prof Dalbey at UCSC. Know what to expect with him - 40% midterm, 60% final - and the exams will be tough. Just put in the time and you will be fine. He can be pretty animated when lecturing, and he brings in interesting asides. Also, he is extremely helpful outside of class. I recommend his Microbial Genetics Lab for a L or W.

Dalbey is very good. Don't listen to anyone who says he is hard. If you go to class and study his material you will get an A. He also give example questions just like his test. Don't cram this course! Keep up with it and you will do fine

The midterm and final were hard, but as someone said he curves A LOT. I had to read the book inside and out which is very time consuming. Some of his exam questions come from the left field. He usually gives you a good idea of what 50% of the exam will look like. The rest of it is up in the air. I liked him as a person though, very helpful.

Dalbey is without a doubt a hard professor. His averages for midterm/final are extremely low, but don't be discouraged. He curves. A LOT! Also, if you read the book and pay attention in lecture you'll do great.

AWESOME teacher! He is SO helpful and wants everyone to do well. He will keep e-mailing us with solutions to problems and other's people's Q&A. I REALLLYYY enjoy his class the most because of his nice personality and his generosity. He is by far the best teacher I've had at SC. The exams I feel are very FAIR so stop complaining!

Took him for bio20A & genetics...genetics with him was fine BUT BIO20A with him is MAD HARD! Hard exam questions ...going to lecture is pointless..avoid bio20a w/him if you can ..do not ruin your GPA! Professor Bowman (who teaches both in summer and fall) is much easier so wait for him

I took Dalbey for Bio 20A and genetics to be honest everyone says his class is so hard blah blah,,, Garbage I studied maybe 1/5 of the time for his classes as I have for other upper Div bio classes and got B+'s just go to class and pay attention better than droning on details for other peoples tests for hours.

wow just took this professor for microbio this summer...and LET ME TELL YOU...this isa great professor in terms of encouragement and help...he is extremely helpful and always available and makes a huge effort for helping the material sink in...he also has a good sense of humor...and he seems to really care about our progress.

Dalbey is an awesome teacher. He really doesn't expect a lot from his students. If you come to class and do a few of the assigned problems you will do well on tests. He is the easiest teacher I've ever had. He is a nice guy too. Just don't be stupid and go into his office hours without specific questions,you'll be wasting your time as well as his.

Dalbey was not as bad as I thought, although, he really does expect you to know the material like the back of your hand. I definitely had to read the textbook in order to be successful but, you should read his notes as well. I believe that's the outline of material he will hold you responsible for. He is approachable at times.

Dalbey can be condescending at times, and extremely vague, but if you do the homework problems online (and you understand them) you will be fine.  You definitely have to study for this class...at least read the chapters.
I didn't find Dalbey's lectures useful so I just studied from the book and I'm glad I did because his tests were pretty detailed. It's not impossible to get an A, but you have to study a lot.

Professor Dalbey was an amazing teacher. His lectures cover the majority of the material on the exam, and his review sessions are really helpful. He's very nice and he tries to make things as clear as possible for students, without babying them.

Although I wish he gave a clearer idea of what to expect on his tests before he gave them (or at least didn't give only two that counted for your entire grade), he's really not as bad as people say he is. Just study hard, go to lecture and discussion, and try to get a copy of his past tests and you should do just fine.
Avoid him and try to get Bowman instead.
Condescending, unapproachable, doesn't look at you most of the time when you talk to him in class (before and after, at break).
dalby is worthless and rude.

This guy rambles on and on about useless crap. I mean, you are better off just taking your textbook to class and reading it there. I bet you would score higher reading that big hunk of textbook than listening to his garble. He makes the subject seem so easy, but when the midterm comes, bam! It's like he throws a huge fart bomb! Study hard to get a

I had Mike for Bio 20A, Biochem and Genetics at UCSC.  Mike is an awesome teacher.  He has difficult exams but he really expects his students to work hard to understand the material.  He can be sarcastic, but also really helpful.  He was one of my favorite teachers - he gets the low ratings only because he teaches the tough classes.

Awful teacher. He's the first class I've ever failed. His teaching style is clear, but does not really cover enough on the test. His tests are very wordy also. Overall, he is a clear lecturer, but he also does not care for the student's well being at all. He does give a huge curve though. =T
Beware!  Lectures only skim the surface of what he wants from you.  Hard to do well unless you want to spend lots of time on the class.  Do not fall behind, its really easy to fall behind.

He was okay. Very funny guy, but his lectures did not cover as much as I'd like. 40% Midterm, 60% Final. He likes to tell stories, but answers everything in a sarcastic manner as if it the book is useless and the student's opinions/questions are a barrier to his teaching. HUGE curve.

really nice guy. and pretty easy for an upper div bio class! i thought bio chem would kick my butt, but it was pretty straightforward. make sure to go to all the workshops he sets up, they give you a free 20 point on the midterms.

Dalbey is a funny guy and very nice. However, he is a horrible teacher. He spends the majority of class time trying to crack jokes instead of teaching. Read the book, memorize it. Know every single picture he's ever put up in lecture. The midterm and final were impossibly hard and I think the material he expected us to know was unfair.

He dumbs down the lectures a lot in comparison to the tests. Grade is 45% midterm (1) 55% final. Midterm was extremely hard and he doesn't tell you what the grades mean. There is a HUGE curve though. Do the practice problems he sends out. At least one shows up on midterm and final. 64% midterm 67% final=B+

Dalbey really wants to help you succeed.  Attend lectures, READ THE BOOK. His lectures highlight areas he feels are important. Careful, as people simply looked at lecture notes and bombed the exam. His tests are HARD. He wants to challenge his students. He makes up for this by grading on a HUGE curve: 72% & 68% on the two midterms, and got an A-.

He'll rip you a new one. Demanding and hardcore,tons of work and loads of reading that is unrelenting. His tests will make you cry and wish you rather had salt poured on your wounds. Those who didn't do well in the Bio series or in O-Chem are going to get raped mercilessly. Get ready to get your butt kicked.

Basically one of the most pretentious, condescending, and loathsome professors out there. Seems to me like he's a little demented and his emails can get are coarse and disrespectful. It's a pain dealing with him. Tests are insanely difficult and lectures are useless. Take him if you want to suffer!

Pay attention to his lecture notes and what he says about them in lecture, his notes are mostly for the MC part.his suggested problems are similar to what he puts on the test, so if you want to do well, do them. didn't really like his humor thou. pretty lame. at least he's making an effort of making his lectures more enjoyable. good teacher overall

Awesome teacher. Makes print out notes so you pay attention in class. Even has video lectures online so you don't have to go to class. Just read (or do practice problems), go to lecture and take notes. always available (at joe's or through email). test are fair.

Organized, and to the point.  His tests encompass very dense material, but if you study hard and read little facts in a 600 page book, and retain it, you may get an A.  If you have a choice take it with DALBEY and NOT LUDWIG!!!

He is a tough teacher, although if you study: read the book, and DO ASSIGNED HW problems, you will have nothing to worry about. His tests are fair, nothing crazy in details but he wants you to know everything and thats a problem coz you dnt know what to expects on the test. If you want an A, be ready to put at least 15 hours a week into this class

he really does want the sutdents to do well and will try to help, all the people complaining probably didnt study and do the suggested problems. doing those and studying the lecture notes is all you need to do well. he is a fair tester. not hard to do well if you work at it.

In order to do well in Mike's class, you need to go to lecture and pay attention and take notes. He makes it easy to do this though as he's very interesting and pretty funny. But you do need to pull some weight, the questions on tests are very specific and sometimes seem unfair. just be in class and keep up somewhat and its fine.
Hard teacher but if you work hard you will take a lot away from the course. There interesting but very hard.

I took his Biochem and Genetics classes. He believes students are always the same, and people won't have interesting questions. Tough material, expects that people should simply just understand it. doing HW would greatly help in learning!

A hard class, but with plenty of study and preparation you can do well. Dalbey is always there to help, in office hours and emails. Don't be intimidated by him, he truly wants students to succeed but he won't be fooled by any slackery so know what you're asking. Tough tests, but very fair. Know everything and you'll have nothing to worry about.

Hes a very fair teacher, but his material is hard and he expects students to learn beyond what he teaches. If you listen to lectures and visit his office hours, you should do fine. But you must be willing to learn BEYOND what he teaches..but overall, hes a cool teacher! he rides his bike everyday to school and is ON TIME! so dont be late for class.
